alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Grayson; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 17 at 9:38PM EST until December 19 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST MONDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM MONDAY TO 3 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, northwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Ashe, Alleghany NC and Watauga Counties. In Virginia, Grayson, Carroll, Floyd and Roanoke Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 1 AM Monday, then again from 7AM Monday to 3PM Tuesday. For the High Wind Warning, from 1 AM to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds will occur early Monday morning through Monday evening.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. This can cause power outages...fallen trees...property damage...and dangerous driving conditions for high profile vehicles. Move unfastened items...such as garbage cans and deck furniture...indoors...including any holiday decorations. People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. Use caution if you must drive.
